definition: to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect

sentences.english: And Micaiah said, Behold, thou shalt see in that day, when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.
sentences.chinese: 米该雅说，你进严密的屋子藏躲的那日，就必看见了。

sentences.english: And Micaiah said, Behold, thou shalt see on that day when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.
sentences.chinese: 米该雅说，你进严密的屋子藏躲的那日，就必看见了。

sentences.english: Micaiah replied, 'You will find out on the day you go to hide in an inner room.'
sentences.chinese: 米该雅说，你进严密的屋子藏躲的那日，就必看见了。

definition: to flee in disorder/to scurry off
to hide/to conceal and avoid (contact)/to keep sth concealed
to curl up/to lie with knees drawn up/to huddle up
to pursue closely/to press/to demand (payment)/to extort (a concession)
variant of 張皇|张皇[zhang1 huang2]
to go to bed/to retire for the night
to find a place where one can fit in/to make one's home/to seek shelter
to fly high and run far (idiom); to leave in a hurry for a distance place
to visit/to go to see what's going on
